title: PAL Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Saint Louis Community College (Kirkwood, MO)
Interview Descriptions: I went in to inquire about the job, was asked a few general questions about my academics, work experience and availability and was hired on the spot. I was told what the pay would be during the interview.

title: Enrollment Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Saint Louis Community College
Interview Descriptions:
6 person panel over Zoom with each person asking their very prepared questions. Some questions seemed very routine while others were certainly tailored to the office.
There were 2 men and 4 women on the panel at varied levels of employment.
Interview Questions: Q: How do you define diversity?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Saint Louis Community College
Interview Descriptions:
Mostly behavioral questions, not technical. Describing situations of overcoming conflict, how to handle priorities and multi-tasking. 
I interviewed with 5 people over Zoom. The did ask about my experience with the college's system.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you had to overcome conflict

title: Coordinator, Student Services Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Saint Louis Community College
Interview Descriptions: Usually applicants are interviewed by a committee.  The committee may range from 3 to as many stake holders needed.  Have interviewed remotely.  Each person asks a question to the applicant.  Usually about 20 questions.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my strengths for the position.

title: Campus Life Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Saint Louis Community College in May 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Sumitted application online
Phone and email communication for the initial interview with a search committee (5 members) for 1 hour (virtual)
1-hour interview with director supervisor and division leader (face to face)
Offer made within one week
Interview Questions:
basic introduction questions
specific job related questions
scenario-based questions
supervision questions

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Saint Louis Community College
Interview Descriptions: Committee interview and usually two rounds.  The first is typically the screening committee and the other is the final interview.  The committee will make a recommendation to the hiring manager so be prepared.  There will be at least 10-15 questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for the community college

title: Project Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Louis Community College (Saint Louis, MO) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Most interviews are conducted by a team/panel of individuals in order to prevent bias. Although this approached is used, often times individuals already have someone in mind for the position.
Interview Questions: What has prepared you for this position?

title: Non-Academic Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Saint Louis Community College
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with preloaded questions. Obviously a standardized hiring process. Lots of "tell us how you" questions with some personalization but not much. 90 minute timeframe. Panel had three people.
Interview Questions: Tell us how you used a weakness as a strength.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Louis Community College
Interview Descriptions: Interview took 1hr, meet with 3 people.  Asked basic questions. Each one of them took turns in asking questions. Was asked to look at the graduation,transfer,drop-out rates and give my opinion.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Technical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Louis Community College (Saint Louis, MO) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: First, phone call interview to quickly touch base followed by a scheduling return phone call.  Second, round table questions and answers asked by would be co-workers and managers of the department as well as department heads.
Interview Questions: Several questions that were asked were not listed anywhere on the Job Description - those seemed to be the focus of follow up questions.
